title: Colin Cowherd Podcast - Prime Cuts: Watson Trade, Baker with Mary Kay Cabot, Matt Mosley on Cowboys Bad FA & Mark Cuban on Luka, Business
itunes:title: Colin Cowherd Podcast - Prime Cuts: Watson Trade, Baker with Mary Kay Cabot, Matt Mosley on Cowboys Bad FA & Mark Cuban on Luka, Business
description:
This is Prime Cuts! The best of The Colin Cowherd Podcast. First Colin's top takes of the week (3:00), including thoughts on Deshaun Watson to the Browns, a prime landing spot for Baker Mayfield, the severe backlash that will come from the Watson signing, why Jimmy G is more in demand than Baker despite uncertainty after surgery on his throwing shoulder.

Then, longtime Browns beat writer Mary Kay Cabot (21:00) to discuss the public divorce between Baker and the Browns, when the relationship became too toxic to run it back, why the Browns felt comfortable signing Watson despite sexual assault allegations, how they are preparing to handle the public backlash and what Mary Kay saw all the way back at the Senior Bowl that gave her reservations about the Browns drafting him 1st overall (49:00).

Next, Cowboys writer - and The Doomsday Podcast host - Matt Mosley (37:00) discusses how off-field scandals involving Jerry Jones and Cowboys execs have impacted Dallas' lackluster free agency period, if Dallas and their the dominant D is due for a pullback after losing Randy Gregory, if Amari Cooper's impact on Dak has been overstated, if Dallas fans could turn on Dak with another season of playoff disappointment.

Finally, Mavs owner - and host of Shark Tank - Mark Cuban (53:00) explains how Luka Doncic has matured since entering the NBA, how today's young stars are different than past generations, how he's connected with his kids using TikTok (26:00), the future of consuming sports media going, and what NBA rule he would change.

Make sure to Subscribe and follow Colin and The Volume on Twitter for the latest content and updates and check out FanDuel for the best wagering and daily fantasy action!

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
